alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Coastal Liberty; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh; Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, MCINTOSH, CHATHAM AND LONG COUNTIES... At 636 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Richmond Hill to Halfmoon Landing, and moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Richmond Hill, Ludowici, Tibet, Coffee Bluff, Windsor Forest, Jones and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
